title: Tesla discontinues Autopilot in bid to boost adoption of its Full Self-Driving software
summary: The company is also currently facing a 30-day suspension of its manufacturing and dealer licenses in California for deceptive marketing about Autopilot's capabilities.

title: Former Sequoia partner’s new startup uses AI to negotiate your calendar for you
summary: Blockit, an AI agent that communicates directly with other calendars, has raised $5 million in seed funding led by Sequoia.

title: Palmer Luckey says the coolest thing about Anduril expanding to Long Beach is the fighter jets
summary: Anduril on Thursday announced its plans to expand its Southern California presence with a major campus in Long Beach, the town where founder Palmer Luckey grew up.

title: OpenAI is coming for those sweet enterprise dollars in 2026
summary: OpenAI has reportedly appointed Barret Zoph to lead its push into enterprise just a week after Zoph rejoined the company.

title: Vimeo starts layoffs after acquisition by Bending Spoons
summary: Vimeo is in the process of laying off some of its global staff after being acquired last year by Bending Spoons for $1.38B.

title: GM to end Chevy Bolt EV production next year, move China-made Buick to US factory
summary: The factory musical chairs reflect an economic and political environment, shaped by the Trump administration's tariff policy and its decision to end the federal EV tax credit.

title: Capital One acquires Brex for a steep discount to its peak valuation, but early believers are laughing all the way to the bank
summary: Before everyone sharpens their knives, consider that for the VCs who backed Brex at its outset, the sale is a triumph.

title: Voice AI engine and OpenAI partner LiveKit hits $1B valuation
summary: The five-year-old-startup powers OpenAI’s ChatGPT voice mode and raised a $100 million round led by Index Ventures.

title: Inference startup Inferact lands $150M to commercialize vLLM
summary: The seed round values the newly formed startup at $800 million.

title: Are AI agents ready for the workplace? A new benchmark raises doubts
summary: New research looks at how leading AI models hold up doing actual white-collar work tasks, drawn from consulting, investment banking, and law. Most models failed.

title: Microsoft 365 hit by outage, preventing access to emails and files
summary: An hours-long outage is preventing Microsoft's enterprise customers from accessing their inboxes, files, and video meetings.

title: Ring is adding a new content verification feature to videos
summary: Ring says the new feature will identify if video edits have been made, even if they're minor.

title: Google DeepMind CEO is ‘surprised’ OpenAI is rushing forward with ads in ChatGPT
summary: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis says the tech giant isn't pressuring him to insert ads into the AI chatbot experience.

title: Humans& thinks coordination is the next frontier for AI, and they’re building a model to prove it
summary: Humans&, a new startup founded by alumni of Anthropic, Meta, OpenAI, xAI, and Google DeepMind, is building the next generation of foundation models for collaboration, not chat.

title: Substack launches a TV app
summary: The move comes as Substack has been investing more heavily in video and livestreaming, as it looks to compete with platforms like YouTube and Patreon for both creators and viewers.

title: Tesla launches robotaxi rides in Austin with no human safety driver
summary: Not all of Tesla's fleet in Austin will be fully driverless. Per Tesla's AI lead Ashok Elluswamy, the company will be "starting with a few unsupervised vehicles mixed in with the broader robotaxi fleet with safety monitors, and the ratio will increase over time."

title: Meta seeks to limit evidence in child safety case
summary: Meta is set to go on trial in New Mexico for allegedly failing to protect minors. The company is requesting a broad swath of information not be allowed to be presented in court.

title: Google now offers free SAT practice exams, powered by Gemini
summary: Students can prompt Gemini by typing "I want to take a practice SAT test,” and the AI will provide them with a free practice exam. Gemini then analyzes the results, highlighting strengths and identifying areas that need further review. It also offers detailed explanations for any incorrect answers.

title: Former CEO of celeb fav gym Dogpound launches $5M fund to back wellness companies
summary: Jenny Liu is a solo first-time GP looking to back underrepresented wellness founders.

title: Struggling fusion power company General Fusion to go public via $1B reverse merger
summary: General Fusion's merger with an acquisition company will net the company over $300 million. Just last year, the company ran into trouble raising money from other investors.

title: Google won’t stop replacing our news headlines with terrible AI
summary: In early December, I brought you the news that Google has begun replacing Verge headlines, and those of our competitors, with AI clickbait nonsense in its content feed. title: Microsoft Paint can now make AI coloring books
summary: Microsoft is giving its Paint and Notepad apps on Windows new AI capabilities for editing text and making digital illustrations. The updates are currently rolling out to Windows Insiders in the Windows 11 Canary and Dev channels, and include features that feel oddly niche or advanced for such simplified apps, such as AI text improvements […]

title: The TikTok deal is done, finally
summary: Just over a year after it briefly disappeared from app stores, TikTok in the US is now part of a new entity, TikTok USDS Joint Venture LLC. With approval from both the US and China closing on the schedule laid out in December, ByteDance's ownership of the new joint venture is now only 19.9 percent […]

title: Ring can verify videos now, but that might not help you with most AI fakes
summary: Ring has launched a new Ring Verify tool that the company says can "verify that Ring videos you receive haven't been edited or changed." But since Ring won't verify videos that have been altered in any way, it probably won't be able to verify those videos you see on TikTok that look like they're from […]

title: Samsung’s smallest Frame TVs have fallen to their lowest prices to date

title: Nintendo is following up Alarmo with a weird Talking Flower in March

title: Epic and Google have a secret $800 million Unreal Engine and services deal

title: Sen. Markey questions OpenAI about ‘deceptive advertising’ in ChatGPT

title: Tiny falcons are helping keep the food supply safe on cherry farms
summary: Their presence appears to lower the risk of food-borne illnesses from pathogens.

summary: It's efficient, easy to live with, and smooth to drive.

title: This 67,800-year-old hand stencil is the world's oldest human-made art
summary: The world's oldest art has an unintentional story to tell about human exploration.

summary: US did not pay $278 million in 2024–2025 dues and millions more in promised funds.

summary: The onslaught includes LLMs finding bogus vulnerabilities and code that won't compile.

summary: Crypto theft was "the worst thing I had ever done."

title: Show HN: isometric.nyc – giant isometric pixel art map of NYC
summary:
Hey HN! I wanted to share something I built over the last few weeks: isometric.nyc is a massive isometric pixel art map of NYC, built with nano banana and coding agents.

I didn't write a single line of code.

Of course no-code doesn't mean no-engineering. This project took a lot more manual labor than I'd hoped!

I wrote a deep dive on the workflow and some thoughts about the future of AI coding and creativity:

http://cannoneyed.com/projects/isometric-nyc

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46721802
